intro: Sinosenecio changii, commonly known as the Yunnan sneezeweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Sinosenecio changii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates.
